|chip1 = Atheros;AR9170; |chip2 = Atheros;AR9101; |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|antconn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |txchains = 1 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 150 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->

|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 03/17/2009 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |price = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B002LAS1DU |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |country = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== rebranded [[Z-Com XN-721AI]] / [[Z-Com XN-721]]
AR9101 = 1x2 SIMO
FCC ID LNQ802AIN redirects to M4Y-XN721V01
"The driver resides directly on the adapter, making CDs or other driver media unneccessary. Simply plugging the USB adapter into an available USB port initiates the install and loads the driver in one step."
{{WiFiCert|WFA7210|03/05/2009}}
[[Category:English Documentation]]
